image.altText: A group of men walk forward at a men's ceremony in Wadeye.

items.synopsis: Bruised and traumatised, resilient and proud — how the troubled outback community of Wadeye in the Northern Territory is trying to shed its violent past and move forward.

title.children: 'They all burned, all the houses': A bush town in anguish tries to heal from its violent past

image.altText: Usman Khawaja is on his back foot as he punches the ball into the off side as Jonny Bairstow watches on

items.synopsis: Usman Khawaja carries his bat to tea through a positive session for Australia, who remain well behind England's first-innings total on day two of the first Ashes Test. Follow all the updates in our live blog.

title.children: Khawaja leads fightback for Australia on day two at Edgbaston

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: A huge cry as Khawaja realised that ball had got through, his 14th four but the one that meant he reached his first century on English soil. He really enjoyed that, and so he should, wheeling away and leaping in the air, waving his bat - it was an emphatic celebration. He even threw his bat away. Scenes. "It is hard to find a weakness in Usman Khawaja's game at the moment once he gets in. He is so, so composed," says Jim Maxwell on ABC Radio. A terrific century that has helped Australia out no end. 102 off 199 balls his total.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Khawaja makes a century!

children.content: A huge cry as Khawaja realised that ball had got through, his 14th four but the one that meant he reached his first century on English soil.
He really enjoyed that, and so he should, wheeling away and leaping in the air, waving his bat - it was an emphatic celebration.
He even threw his bat away. Scenes.
"It is hard to find a weakness in Usman Khawaja's game at the moment once he gets in. He is so, so composed," says Jim Maxwell on ABC Radio.
A terrific century that has helped Australia out no end.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: A magical ball from Moeen Ali! Drift away, turn back in and Green was bowled through the gate to the top of off stump. A terrific piece of bowling and Cameron Green has to go for 38 off 68.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: BOWLED HIM WITH A BEAUTY! GREEN HAS TO GO!

children.content: A magical ball from Moeen Ali!
Drift away, turn back in and Green was bowled through the gate to the top of off stump.
A terrific piece of bowling and Cameron Green has to go for 38 off 68.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Big session for Australia, thanks to Usman Khawaja and Travis Head. Cameron Green, too, was showing some intent late. Strangely, in the final over before the break. The English bowlers are struggling to elicit much action right now, and Khawaja and Green are both looking pretty solid out there. But so too was Travis Head. All it takes is one moment to change the game completely.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: TEA: Australia 4-188 (Khawaja 84, Green 21)

props.alt: Cameron Green completes a cricket shot.

children.content: Big session for Australia, thanks to Usman Khawaja and Travis Head.
Cameron Green, too, was showing some intent late. Strangely, in the final over before the break.
The English bowlers are struggling to elicit much action right now, and Khawaja and Green are both looking pretty solid out there.
But so too was Travis Head. All it takes is one moment to change the game completely.

image.altText: Patrick Dangerfield concentrates as he kicks the football

items.synopsis: Geelong captain Patrick Dangerfield joins the list of South Australians affected by the state's ramping crisis, as he is forced to wait in a ramped ambulance outside the Royal Adelaide Hospital with a partially collapsed lung and a cracked rib after sustaining an injury in Thursday night's match.

title.children: Patrick Dangerfield among patients forced to wait outside RAH as SA's ramping crisis worsens

image.altText: A smiling man wearing a navy suit and holding state budget papers stands in front of a glass window

items.synopsis: South Australia is on track to reach a debt figure of $37.6 billion within the next four years, in what the opposition has described as "astronomical". But Treasurer Stephen Mullighan says it's below what has been previously predicted.

title.children: South Australia's budget shows the state's debt is growing. Here's why it's in the red

image.altText: A phone box with police tape around it and a police van

items.synopsis: South Australia Police are trying to find a woman who called triple-zero from a public phone box in Adelaide's north-east yesterday in a distressed state, telling the operator she had recently given birth.

title.children: 'Grave concerns' for woman who called triple-zero from phone box, telling police she had given birth

image.altText: A composite image of armed police and a man on a Melbourne tram

items.synopsis: Police allege the 57-year-old man had earlier stole items from a CBD business before attempting to flee on the tram.

title.children: Police storm Melbourne CBD tram after man holds passenger at knifepoint

image.altText: A friendly-looking older man in a business shirt and tie sits at a table, looking to the right of the frame.

items.synopsis: A fiercely independent savant, Triplett was the subject of a book, a documentary and countless medical journal articles.

title.children: Donald Triplett, the first person to be diagnosed with autism, dies at 89

image.altText: Bwera General hospital

items.synopsis: Police say rebels from the Allied Democratic Forces carried out the raid, burning down a dormitory and abducting an unknown number or people.

title.children: Militants attack school in Uganda, killing at least 41, including 38 students

image.altText: A man walks while smoke rises above buildings after aerial bombardment

items.synopsis: The attack was one of the deadliest of the clashes in urban areas of Khartoum and elsewhere in Sudan between the military and a powerful paramilitary group known as the Rapid Support Forces(RSF).

title.children: Air strike kills at least 17 in Sudan's capital, including five children

image.altText: Two professional cyclists on bicycles talk amid a crowd of cyclists.

items.synopsis: The team made the announcement on Saturday, two days after Mäder's death during the final descent on stage five of the eight-day race.

title.children: Bahrain Victorious team, others withdraw from Tour de Suisse after Gino Mäder's death

image.altText: A woman holds an Airtag in her hand near her bag.

items.synopsis: Apple's Airtags and similar devices like Tile are marketed as useful tools for people to keep track of their belongings. But domestic violence awareness groups say that in the wrong hands, the devices can be used to track people against their wishes.

title.children: 'One is more horrific than the next': When women discovered they'd been stalked with Airtags, they took their fight to Apple

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaking at Victorian Labor Conference.

items.synopsis: The prime minister announces a $2 billion one-off investment — which will be distributed among the states and territories within the next two weeks — during a speech at the Victorian Labor Conference.

title.children: Albanese announces $2 billion investment in social housing around Australia

image.altText: Ukrainian servicemen look under debris in a street for booby-traps.

items.synopsis: Ukraine is covered in more landmines, booby traps and unexploded ordnance than any other country in the world. As the conflict rages on, what resources and innovations will help the de-mining community tackle the issue?

title.children: New 'jumping' explosives and booby-trapped toys. What Ukraine is facing as the world's most mined country

image.altText: 8 men in 1940s casual attire lean against wood hut in pow camp Nangwarry SA

items.synopsis: A few old slabs of concrete buried deep in pine forests are all that remain of south-east South Australia's prisoner of war camps. But their history is being uncovered by new research that shines a light on the stories of the men interned in the region.

title.children: How Italian prisoners of war and Australian families kept 'strong bonds' of friendship after WWII

image.altText: a composite image of footy players, people on surf boards and emergency personnel at a sporting field

items.synopsis: Moments before kick-off, a clash between the Kurri Kurri and Central Newcastle rugby league sides has been awash with sadness — a feeling mirrored across Australia as  people have paid tribute to the Greta bus crash victims.

title.children: Black armbands, minute's silence and paddle out for victims of Hunter Valley bus crash

image.altText: a couple holding a portrait with their baby, in his nursery

items.synopsis: An internal review found Alby's death in the delivery room was a rare obstetric emergency, but his grieving parents say they are unhappy with the care they received.

title.children: The hospital said baby Alby's death was due to a 'rare obstetric emergency'. His parents want to know how it happened

image.altText: A man in silhouette stands near a boat on a beach, looking out to sea at during a pink and gold sunset.

items.synopsis: The mayor of Palm Island in North Queensland says the telco's arrival is "great news" for the remote Indigenous community that will create jobs and launch the island into the "corporate world".

title.children: Half of this remote island has no internet — but it is about  to host Telstra's newest call centre

image.altText: A small brown mushroom sprouts from dark green grass

items.synopsis: While very few patients are expected to access new psychedelic therapies when regulatory changes take effect next month, medicinal cannabis companies, drug developers and health insurers are keeping watch on the emerging industry.

title.children: Rules around psychedelics are about to change, and an unsurprising player is entering the market

image.altText: The arrest of Joanne Warren at Huskisson in April 2020, and Joanne Warren outside the church today.

items.synopsis: A woman receives compensation from police after being wrongfully handcuffed and placed in a paddy wagon while walking by a protest to protect a heritage church on the NSW South Coast.

title.children: Woman 'thrown to the ground and arrested' by police at 'peaceful' church protest gets $60k payout

image.altText: Mungbeans in the dirty palm of a farmer's hand.

items.synopsis: Mung beans are one of the world's smallest vegetables. But there is a huge global market for this tiny — and valuable — crop.

title.children: Packing a gram-for-gram protein punch equal to a T-bone steak, demand for this tiny legume is booming

image.altText: Fox News chyron reading, "Wannabe dictator speaks at the White House after having his political rival arrested."

items.synopsis: Alex McCaskill, a longtime producer for former Fox News host Tucker Carlson is dropped by the network after being found responsible for an on-air headline that referred to US President Joe Biden as a "wannabe dictator".

title.children: Fox News ousts former Tucker Carlson producer over headline describing Biden as 'wannabe dictator'

items.synopsis: Nine men from Egypt, aged between 20 and 40 years old, were arrested, detained and charged on Friday, for people smuggling and participating in a criminal enterprise.

title.children: Death toll for Greek shipwreck rises to 500, as survivors reunite on mainland

image.altText: a helicopter flies above a village and giant rock face

items.synopsis: Relieved residents of a village in south-east Switzerland say a huge rock mass, which was feared would fall and destroy their homes, has come down but stopped just short of their settlement.

title.children: Rockfall narrowly misses Swiss village

image.altText: A man wearing a blue suit.

items.synopsis: The SA government has committed to implementing nine recommendations made in a report that revealed a boy was restrained and secluded in breach of hospital guidelines in 2021.

title.children: SA government commits to changes after boy was restrained face down at children's hospital

items.synopsis: A McDonald's manager who was punched and spat on by a customer tells the Adelaide Magistrates Court he still has flashbacks of the incident and has to attend therapy sessions.

title.children: 'Absolutely disgusted': Victims of McDonald's 'rampage' tell court of trauma

image.altText: An image of a woman in her kitchen.

items.synopsis: The state opposition and a business group say the Labor government's budget doesn't address rising expenses for households and businesses, with one Adelaide carer welcoming relief measures but describing them as "band-aid at the best".

title.children: SA budget a 'slap in the face' for the average household, opposition says

image.altText: A small marsupial mole in cupped hands

mediaThumbnail.caption: The rarely seen golden haired marsupial mole was spotted near Uluru recently by Alice Springs shoemaker James Young. The small silky creature has no eyes and relies on its claws to swim beneath the sand country.

document.caption: The rarely seen golden haired marsupial mole was spotted near Uluru recently by Alice Springs shoemaker James Young. The small silky creature has no eyes and relies on its claws to swim beneath the sand country.
document.synopsis: The rarely seen golden haired marsupial mole was spotted near Uluru recently by Alice Springs shoemaker James Young. The small silky creature has no eyes and relies on its claws to swim beneath the sand country.

synopsisAlt.sm: The rarely seen golden haired marsupial mole was spotted near Uluru recently by Alice Springs shoemaker James Young. The small silky creature has no eyes and relies on its claws to swim beneath the sand country.

document.title: The elusive marsupial mole spotted at Uluru

titleAlt.lg: The elusive marsupial mole spotted at Uluru
titleAlt.md: The elusive marsupial mole spotted at Uluru
titleAlt.sm: The elusive marsupial mole spotted at Uluru

items.synopsis: The marsupial mole is completely blind, "swims" through the desert sand and rarely ventures above ground. But one eagle-eyed traveller is in "disbelief" after spotting one attempting to cross the road.

title.children: 'Very rarely seen' marsupial with 'silky' golden fur spotted near Uluru

image.altText: A coach and players of a Super Netball team hug and smile after a win in the team's final game.

items.synopsis: The Fever will have to defend their Super Netball crown via a knockout final after being stunned 65-62 by Collingwood in Launceston, as the Thunderbirds down the Swifts in Sydney.

title.children: Fever shocked in Magpies' last-ever Super Netball game after Thunderbirds down the Swifts

image.altText: Screenshot1

items.synopsis: The Sussex crowd is left in raptures as T20 Blast debutant Brad Currie takes one of the most spectacular catches in cricket history.

title.children: 'He can't quite believe it': Is this the best catch in the history of cricket?

image.altText: a ref tries to break up two men involved in pushing and shoving

items.synopsis: Officials have been trying to stamp out the troubling tradition among Mexican soccer fans for years.

title.children: Homophobic chants bring early end to soccer match between US and Mexico

image.altText: A composite of three people - a young man, a young woman and and older man.

items.synopsis: The man police believe is behind a fatal attack in the English city of Nottingham will face court over the weekend as thousands gather to mourn the victims.

title.children: Police charge Nottingham attack suspect with three counts of murder
